info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 6:16PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Laurens, northwestern Chester, northeastern Greenville, Spartanburg, central Cherokee and northern Union Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 616 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Gaffney to 14 miles west of Spartanburg. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spartanburg, Gaffney, Union, Greer, Five Forks, Fountain Inn, Boiling Springs SC, Woodruff, Duncan and Lyman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for Upstate South Carolina.
